page.title: 04A LARGE FARM IN WENT HILLS
page.content: The{Stapleton Estate}is a very large{arable farm employing}ten workers. The farm covers two thousand acres. Wheat and barley are grown and sold through a merchant. Some goes for export. The sugarbeet is{transported down the A1 to Nottingham for processing. Mustard is grown for a company based in Norwich. Peas are grown for sale locally and for freezing by a freezer plant which is partly owned by the owner of Stapleton Park. The Estate has facilities for washing the peas before sending them for freezing. The{Farm Shop}in{Darrington}belongs to the Estate, but is rented out. It still sells peas from the Estate. The former fishponds of Stapleton Hall are stocked with trout, and the{fishing {rights}are privately leased.
